definition[0]: when you feel doubt about what will happen
example[0]: Times of great change are also times of uncertainty.
example[1]: There is a great deal of uncertainty about the company’s future.
definition[1]: a situation which you are not sure about because you do not know what will happen
definition[2]: a situation when what will happen in the future is likely to change, often in a way that is bad
example[4]: Exchange rate uncertainty is bound to reduce investment.
example[5]: The announcement ends months of uncertainty over the contract’s future.
